name: Future Skills for Employment
description:
The department of Electronics and Communication organized an Alumni talk on “Future Skills for Employment” from 27.05.2020 to 30.05.2020. The objective of this series is to bring insights and to showcase the available opportunities in the market in core fields like VLSI design, Embedded technologies, Agile techniques, and data science to the students. This series was formally inaugurated by the Head of the department, Dr. J. Raja. Our alumni Mr. T. A. Bharathwaj (2004-2008 batch), Senior Technical Lead at HCL Technologies, made his presence and delivered the talk on “Scope for Electronics – Idea to Chip design” on 27.05.2020. The importance of the Digital Industry was emphasized through the topic “Agile mindset - Evolution of digital industry” by Mr. E. Balaji, Systems Engineer at Infosys Limited on 28.05.2020. The students were also given knowledge about career opportunities in Embedded systems by Mr. G. Mukesh, R&D Developer at TCS Pvt Ltd, on 29.05.2020. In the future, it is inevitable to deal with data and data science. The importance and opportunities in the field of Machine Learning and Data Science were delivered by Mr. Arun Rajagopal (2007-2011 batch), Principal Data Scientist at Affinity Solutions, New York City, USA. The students of II Year, III Year, and IV Year actively participated in the webinar on all four days and made the session more interactive by flooding the questions to the expert members. Even some interested I Year students also participated in this webinar. We, the students and staff members of the department, were also very happy to extend our thanks to our own alumni, who accepted the invitation in a short span of time and shared their experiences and possible opportunities awaiting their peer group students in this pandemic situation.

Number of students attended every day: 215 (all years)
Maximum of 350 students attended the webinar (All year students)

name: Alumni Meet 2018
description: The Alumni Meet 2018, held on Saturday, June 16, 2018, was a vibrant gathering of former students reconnecting and celebrating their shared experiences. The event featured networking sessions, panel discussions with distinguished alumni, and a gala dinner. Highlights included engaging entertainment, a campus tour showcasing recent developments, and the presentation of awards to notable alumni. It was a memorable evening, fostering a strong sense of community and camaraderie among graduates.
